body: If I use UniformStreamByteDistributor, it writes all pending bytes when testing HTTP/2 with Chrome.

@normanmaurer, I reproduced the hang on master. And it does appear `UniformStreamByteDistributor` doesn't have the same failure. I can't reproduce the problem on v4.1.8, but I can on v4.1.9, which is interesting because nothing really changed in either the weighted distributor or the remote flow controller.
I'm mistaken. Commit 3482651 happened between the two and I have verified it introduced the bug. That should help in figuring out what's broken.
@ejona86 so you will take a look ?
@normanmaurer, yeah, I'll still investigate more. I don't get much work done on Tuesdays, so tomorrow is when I'll probably be able to get back to it.
thanks for looking into this @ejona86 ... this does seem like a bug but maybe in other areas too ... I can take a stab at a PR

good find ... after looking a bit more it seems to be the only place where this bug occurs. We should be able to share code with [1] too. Also I need to review when we prematurely exit if the parent's state object cannot be found ... I'm concerned we may not write to the child stream if it is in the active state ... I need to investigate more.

[1] https://github.com/netty/netty/blob/4.1/codec-http2/src/main/java/io/netty/handler/codec/http2/WeightedFairQueueByteDistributor.java#L125

issue.title: Fix HTTP/2 dependency tree corruption

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

Chrome was randomly getting stuck loading the tiles examples.
Investigation showed that the Netty flow controller thought it had
nothing to send for the connection even though some streams has queued
data and window available.

Modifications:

Fixed an accounting error where an implicitly created parent was not
being added to the dependency tree, thus it and all of its children were
orphaned from the connection's tree and would never have data written.

Result:

Fixes #6621
